column4: I've always used the full location, not the shortcut. IE: /home/username/directory/ instead of ~/directory/
: i will give it a shot. :)
: can you copy the exact from rtorrent.rc for me please. i can't it to work still by using long path.
this is mine http://pastebin.com/m9a50abf
: thanks very much! now i will try to figure out this once and for all. :-P
you may have to make that directory location if you haven't already. rtorrent may not create it on its own.
: yeah, tried first without creating dir and then it didnt work, so i tried again after mkdir, but still it doesnt want to do it! aaaaaaaaaaa! :-P
: the only things i have edited in rtorrent.rc is: "download_rate = 100", "upload_rate = 30" and "directory = /home/kristian/torrent/" and the rtorrent.rc is located /home/kristian/rtorrent.rc
rtorrent can be touchy. sometimes it helps to restart the app or remove and reload .torrent files in order to get things to work right.
: have tried, but will try again. :)

: tried and not working! :( this is what i have done: "sudo apt-get install rtorrent", "cp /usr/share/doc/rtorrent/examples/rtorrent.rc ~/" and edited with settings i said above and run rtorrent, added torrent by backspace, and it will download to /home/username and not where i set.
just a wild guess, do you have ownership of the rtorrent.rc file?
: im not quite sure what you mean by "ownership"?
I'm wondering if your rtorrent.rc is named correctly or that you have ownership of it. It should be named .rtorrent.rc with the leading period to make it "hidden".
: umm! will have a look.
: that might be it! there is no leading .! brb!
: thank you!!! :) i copyed the file, when i should have copied the example file and renamed it with a "." infront.
excellent.... glad I could help. everything's working as expected, then?
: well, yes, i've only set three options, so far, but guess i can start configuring it a bit more. :)

: don't now much about what to set as maximum and minimum peers, guess ill google a bit. anyways, its downloading to correct dir and dl/ul max speeds are set, so i should be fine for some time. :) thanks again.
great! that's a start in the right direction at least.
